column4: If I install Ubuntu 10.04 and choose to install updates, will any of those updates include a kernel update?
I'm having problems with the kernel in 11.04
so I want to try 10.04
every time i boot
It doesn't hurt to try. Process of elimination
I've searched all around the web for what "net: registered protocol family 1"
actually means
everyone says to just boot acpi=off or maxcpus=1
what's the actual problem?
Is it booting to there and then hanging?
yeah DanaG, just hangs
Ah.
can i make it bypass the hang?
if i hit a key it will still boot
performance wise there isn't a problem with 11.04 for me
try booting with "ignore_loglevel debug" instead of "quiet splash"?
yes at least for amd64
ill try that DanaG: thanks
if i boot without queit splash will that get rid of the splash screen all together?
yeah.
And "ignore_loglevel debug" makes sure it'll show all messages.
oh so it won't make it stop hanging then DanaG?
who knows... it might help the hang, but even if it doesn't, it'll let you see what it's doing before the hang.
